subject: Home & DIY
title: Why Smart Homes Need Local Processing
description: A quick win: understand Why Smart Homes Need Local Processing.

hook.text: Most smart devices send data to cloud servers. If the internet goes down, your 'smart' home becomes very dumb.

buildup.text: Cloud means every light command travels to a server overseas and back. Latency can hit 1-2 seconds.

discovery.text: Local processing keeps automation logic on a hub in your home. Commands execute in millisecondsâ€”even without internet.

twist.text: Cloud devices die when the company does. Google killed Nest Secure; Insteon collapsed overnight.

climax.text: Home Assistant processes everything locally. It has 2,000+ integrations and zero cloud dependency.

punchline.text: The smartest home doesn't need the internet to work.

quiz.question: What happens to cloud-dependent smart devices when the company shuts down?
options: They switch to a basic local mode automatically
Another company always acquires and maintains them
